text: Bottle, almost opaque dark brown beer, nice cream colored head, some lace. Aroma dark malts, chocolate, cloves, dark fruit and honey. Taste is honey, dates, cloves, chocolate, fig, coconut. Palate is pretty light, carbonation average. Drinks a bit like a Baltic Porter. This all comes together with lots of flavor, not too sweet, and high drinkability. This is a winner!
12 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $8.99/6-pack. Very good.
Pours a hazy copper brown color with a creamy off-white head. Aroma of bread, banana, and nuts. Banana and clove flavor with some bread. Decent beer.
While it looks like a Dunkelweizen, it tastes and smells just like a Hefeweizen. I love the clove/banana aroma and taste. Really nice job, John Marra!

Bottled. Poured coppery-amber with a short-lived head. The aroma picked up sweet banana and nutty notes with light accents of cocoa and vanilla. The flavor found semi-sweet cocoa, caramel, and overripe banana at the core with peppery notes and prickly carbonation around. Light-medium bodied and scratchy on the palate.. only OK feel.

Bot, somewhat difficult brew. Could use some manners. Youd never know this was dunk weiz unless I saw the label; was thinking a helles or something, but what do I know? Glad to see its dunkel weizen but was expecting something a little more civilized. Fairly mild but keeps a little kick in the alky. And yea I guess the wheat starts to come thru on the finish.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: brown color; dark fruit, banana, and clove aroma; dark fruit, banana, and clove notes on a bready, grainy, wheat malt bas

Bottle pour into pint glass from Cigarette City, Seabrook, NH. Aroma is strong banana, fruity esters. Appearance is hazy reddish brown with nice sparkle, 1/2 finger-width head with poor persistence and minimal lacing. Taste is as aroma with some bread and cereal, late clove. Palate is light bodied with thin texture and lively carbonation (a bit too much of a zing to the tongue) and sweet fruity and slight cereal and clove finish. Overall, some nice flavors and aroma but not as complex as advertised. A little too carbonated.

Bottle.Slightly hazy brown beer with a dark cream head. Spice and caramel aroma with light wheat. Citrus and caramel flavor with light wheat and spice. Medium bodied. Wheat and citrus lingers with spice and light caramel.
Deep brown with a great tan head. Banana and clove nose. Strong banana bread taste throughout, fades a little sour (but not overwhelming). Carbonation helps temper the sweetness. Complex. Solid.

Pours a dark Amber with a frothy, well-sustained head - nose of dark bread, caramelized sugars, clove, banana, pepper - creamy, soft texture - medium sweet with dark bread, clove, a pronounced pepper/spicy phenolic character through the middle and finish - light tartness/acidity on the tail end - well-executed take on the style.

Great aroma of caramelized banana; dirty dull brown color; nice banana clove flavor, slightly sweet and camarel, a touch of bubblegum; medium body, good mouthfeel; really nice dunkelweizen, u like it quite a bit.

Nice dark brown coloured body with a little muddy glow of brown and a nice two centimetre tall tan head. Aroma of yeast, wheat and sugars with a bit of fruit noticeable. Medium-bodied; Assertive malty flavours coupled with the pit fruits and a smooth caramel finish, still showing a lot of malt and earth. Aftertaste is robust with the yeast and wheat really noticeable, also with some pit fruits, some earth, some nuts and a touch of grapes. Aftertaste is nice and rich with the malt really the first thing that sticks around, but also showing a faint sweetness. Overall, a good beer, but perhaps not one of the best dunkelweizens out there - still a worthy shot and a good try all around. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Knightly Spirits (Orange Blossom Trail) in Orlando, Florida on 02-October-2015

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine (Raleigh-North Hills). Murky brown pour with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of bubblegum and cloves. Taste is of very ripe banana, allspice, and faint nutmeg. A perfect blend of sweetness from the banana flavors, spiciness, and dark malted wheat. Very well done.
Pours mahogany into a Sam glass. Off-white head with medium retention recedes to skim surface. Banana and clove aromas. Soft with sweet banana bread and nutmeg front to back.
355ml bottle. Dark brown pour, pretty decent stuff actually, big banana on the nose, clovey, well balanced for a dunkelweizen.

12oz bottle pours with a clear amber colored body that supports a weak dark tan head. The aroma offers up prune and date and raisin like fruity esters along with some soft thin smoky notes. The taste delivers a rush of raisin and prunes as well as a blend of smoky brown sugar. Pretty nice as it gets faintly peppery here and there too.
Bottle from Wegmans. Brownish ruby pour with minimal head. Nose is earthy malt, banana, spice, nutmeg. Tastes earthy, with notes of banana, malt, clove, and some toffee in the finish.
12 ounce bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown with a nice off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, fruit, and spice. Taste is banana, malt, caramel, clove, and yeast. Pretty good.

Decent representation of style. About average-medium on the malt....chocolate and caramel, with good amount of wheat in there. Mild spices and hops to even out. Seems a bit macro as Sammy has been trending towards, but overall ok flavor and feel.

12 oz bottle from a mixed six. Clear dark brown, tall, but short lived tan head.Aroma very light, but there is bubblegum, banana, toast. Flavor is sweet, fruity, banana, dark bread, bubblegum. Body is thin and finish is short.

Samuel Adams LongShot Dark Night in Brooklyn doesnt quite nail the dunkelweiss category, but is tasty in its own right. Dark brown pour with an ample off-white head. Not much aroma. Taste is yeasty with just touch of sour and slight spicy notes. I didnt get the expected banana. Dark Night is not a bad take on a traditional German style.

Mixed sixer purchased at CBC, Portsmouth location. Dark mahogany color, slowly fading head on the liquid. Aroma is mild banana, clove, caramel. 
Flavor is pretty nice for interpreting a German dunkelweizen, banana and clove through the center with a sweet malt and grain finish. Big clove element. Creamy carbonation with a decent body. Simple to drink, nice recipe Mr. Marta! Pleasant drinking.

12 ounce bottle into weizen glass, best before 10/2015. Pours slightly hazy deep ruby red/brownish color with a 2 finger dense and fluffy off white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of banana, bubblegum, clove, pear, apple, caramel, wheat, toast, brown bread, light chocolate/nuttiness, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/earthy yeast and dark/bready malt notes; with good strength. Taste of banana, bubblegum, clove, pear, apple, caramel, wheat, toast, brown bread, light chocolate/nuttiness, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Light herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of banana, bubblegum, clove, caramel, wheat, toast, brown bread, light chocolate/nuttiness, and herbal/yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/earthy yeast and dark/bready malt flavors; with a great malt/yeast spice balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth and fairly creamy/bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish. Overall this is a damn nice dunkelweizen style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/earthy yeast and dark/bready malt flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Color is a dark brown. White cap, light lace. Aroma has some fruit ester, slight caramel-chocolate, spice, banana, clove. Taste is same with some smooth body medium, citrus tang, tangy dry finish clove all throughout. It gets pretty clovey as it warms, something Im not a fan of. The taste overall goes downhill with warming also.
12 ounce bottle. Caramel-brown in color. Hint of banana in the aroma. Lighter in flavor than many German Wheat beers. Lots of carbonation without a huge head of foam.
Aroma is dark malts, brown/dark bread and a hint of sweetness. The flavor is toffee/light caramel, dark malts, mild sweetness, brown/dark bread and a slightly sour/tangy finish.

12oz bottle. Caramel-brown body. Pretty solid example of the style. Better than typical Sam Adams for sure. Medium bodied, but still has lots of flavor and character. Mellow doughy brown chocolate notes, but a mild balanced crispness too, more of a classic flavor use. Didnt really grow on me that much, but it was pretty good.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2015 Pours a horehound candy color with a quickly fading tan head. Rich caramel dominates the less obtrusive roasted malt in the nose. Full mouthfeel with burning carbonation. Immediate sweet caramel, but instantly becoming much drier with coinciding banana and clove.

Bottle from Total Wine in Folsom, CA. Pours cola cola with a slight beigeish head. Aroma of clove, banana, and light treacle. Med body or nearly. Flavor fits the aroma, tho theres a wheatish intrusion. Overall this is incredibly tasty. SA ought to consider putting this in the permanent brew list!

Six-pack of 12 ounce Bottles - $7.99 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia

Appearance: Pours a clear, medium brown body with a small-sized, very short-lived, near white head.

Smell: Predominately toasty, just a tad nutty. Faint caramel, chocolate, though it comes out a bit more upon warmth. Minor spice element. Slight banana and a little dark fruitiness. 

Taste: A taste of toasted grain (a bit nutty), a thin, faint edge of roastiness with sweetish hints of caramel and cocoa. A modest pinch of spices, a bit of banana and raisin. Light hop character and supporting bitterness. Still a bit nutty on the lightly sweetish finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light. Medium carbonation.

Overall: A sufficient dunkelweiss.

Orange/brown color with a ecru colored head. Toffee, marzipan and mild spices in the aromas. Sweeter start with wheat and pale malts. Mild yeasts and spice components. Light feel. A Mild dunkel weiss.
The aroma is papery with brown sugar and a touch of fruitiness. The appearance is light brown. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is average. Overall this is good.

Dark with brown sugar, some paper, nuts. Malt with little hop. Not that impressive

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Deep amber with a decent tan head. Aroma of banana, dark fruit and caramel. Taste has less fruit and more spice and grain.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle best by August, 2015 poured into a weizen glass. Translucent medium brown with small beige head. Aroma is dark malty banana, light body, low carbonation, and some lacing. Taste is dark malt, banana, some clove, and some chocolate.
Bottle from bhensonb. Pours dark brown with a thick beige head and a fruit and treacle aroma. There is a hearty dark malt flavor with some plum, banana and cloves. Very dry finish.

Pour is a dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is very nutty and a nice chewy dark malt with some banana in there. Flavor is dark lager malt flavor with some whole wheat bread. Finish is smooth and has a nice rustic graininess. The world needs more good dunkelweizens like this.
Bottle from craft. This was damn good Dunkel. Nice notes of dark fruit, nuts, banana dark wheat. Got better as it warmed. Thats when the spices came out to play. Well Done.

Ruddy mahogany pour with a three finger, creamy beige head that has great retention. Aroma is lemon, sweet wheat, banana, bubblegum, a hint of clove, dry, crusty and sweet wheat bread, cereal, floral, spicy and bright citrus hops. Flavor is sweet wheat, light, juicy and sweet citrus, passion fruit, banana, clove, bubblegum, toasted, husky grain. Light to medium body, creamy to sticky entry, light carbonation and off dry, somewhat chalky and somewhat syrupy finish. Really tasty stuff overall. I wish they would just put some of the better received Longshot series stuff in their seasonal mix packs. I could drink a tone of this stuff, especially in the fall when I seem to like German-Style Wheat beers the best.
Starts of with a lightly dusty aroma, but that goes away. Light banana and clove play well with light roast in the nose and flavor. An enjoyable dunkelweisse.
Deep amber bordering on brown with a frothy off white head that persists. Fruity spicy peppery caramel with a hint of earth. Decent drinker.
bottle. light brown with small head. sweet banana and mild wheat. light spicing. fits what i expect from this series. safe and true to style, but not terribly unique.

Bottle. Banana, clove, chocolate malt, and straw aroma. Dark brown with nice tan head. Sweet light banana/clove, chocolate malt, and mildly bitter herbal hay flavor. Okay body. Not bad but flavor a bit boring.
Bottle. It poured a cloudy brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of bananas, raisins and tropical fruits. The taste was similar to the aroma with more bananas, dark fruits and wheat malts. Nice.
dark wheat shell, dark cereal, light fruit .. . 12oz from sixer .. brown, minimal head .. mouth is balanced, very drinkable .. a great dunkel, a pleasure to drink .. . did your little ears explode!?

It pours a clear reddish brown with another fine and long lasting head of foam. Good lacing. 

The smell has notes of cloves, banana, sweet malt. .like I wanted it to smell.

The taste doesnt disappoint. Wonderful DW flavours of everything that I mentioned above. With a bit of chocolate. 

Smooth creamy mouthfeel. 
Excellent example of the style.
I really like this one. the aroma is quite nice, a mixture of fruit with some malt. the flavor is really nice, some we eat some fruit but very smooth.

Pours mahogany brown with some bronze tint and a tan head. The aroma has smooth creamy malt, light nuttiness, light toffee, lots of toast and lager roundedness. It has a medium smooth creamy body with soft carbonation. The flavor starts with creamy chestnuts, toffee, horehound candy, smooth toast and all of the tastes smooth. The finish adds a touch of molasses. Pretty nice dunkel.

Bottle:
Pours slightly cloudy brown with a tall beige head.
Banana, raisin, caramel aroma.
Taste is sweet, banana, dark fruit, dark wheat malt.
Very tasty.
On tap. Tan-dk copper. A-banana, med malt. T-raisin, banana, sweet med malt, some spice hops.

Pours a fairly dark brown, with whitish tan head. Aroma is malty with notes of fruit. Taste is a bit sweet, with lots of malt, and nice hints of banana and dark fruits. A tasty and somewhat different brew. Thumbs up.
